post_text:
Attention DCS Parents:

As we plan to open our doors this September, parents have many choices about instruction, transportation, food and nutrition, and communication.

In order to finalize plans and details for reopening, please indicate the instructional and transportation choices for your child for the 2020-2021 school year by completing the Parent Commitment Form at www.dolgeville.org. For families with multiple students, please complete a separate form for each child.

Any questions? Please email schoolreopening@dolgeville.org. If you do not have internet, you may also fill out a paper copy in the Elementary or HS office or call 315.429.3155.

post_text:
Reminder - 6th Grade Promotion Tour is Monday!
Staff will leave DCS at approximately 9AM. Our route between 9AM and 12PM will include Irish Settlement Rd, Seeley Rd, 29A, McClure Rd, Red School House Rd, Dutchtown Rd, Irondale Rd, North Rd, Mang Rd, Jerseyfield Rd, Curtiss Rd, Military Rd, and Route 29. We will head back to Dolgeville after Shedd and Moore Rds, around 12:30PM. Dolgeville visits are scheduled until about 3PM, including Barker Rd.
We appreciate your patience and will include updates on Remind and Facebook as service permits! Congratulations to the Class of 2026!

post_text:
DCS staff are planning a special visit to each 6th grader‚Äôs home on Monday, June 22nd. We will be starting our delivery of Promotion Certificates and Awards in the town of Stratford, then will continue to Salisbury and the Village of Dolgeville. Visits to each student will be brief (2-3 minutes). We ask all 6th graders to come to the end of their driveways when we arrive for a quick celebration photo! If you would prefer to have your certificates mailed in lieu of delivery, please contact the Elementary Office. If your 6th grader will be at an alternative address, please let your Homeroom Teacher know! We will send updates with approximate arrival times via Remind.
Please check Google Classroom or Remind messages from Homeroom Teachers for more information!

post_text:
It's District Budget Vote time!!!

Your Absentee Ballots are being prepared!
Our list of those to get a ballot has come from the Herkimer and Fulton Cty. Board of Elections as well as Dolgeville CSD polling lists from previous budget votes.

All Absentee Ballots will be mailed from Dolgeville on May 27, 2020. Each ballot package includes an addressed/postage paid envelope to return your vote. All ballots need to be returned by 5:00pm on June 9, 2020.

You will also be receiving our Budget Newsletter (most likely at the same time as your ballot). The Budget Newsletter will also be available on our website beginning Friday, May 22nd.

Once ballots are out - if a qualified voter in your home needs a ballot -- please contact Sandy Allen, District Clerk 315-429-3155 x3501

post_text:
NOTICE ON SCHOOL DISTRICT WEBSITE:
DEADLINE FOR FILING NOMINATING PETITIONS

PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that petitions for nominating candidates for office must be filed in the District Clerk‚Äôs office by 5:00 p.m. on May 11, 2020. Under NYS Governor Executive Order No. 202.26, there is no minimum threshold of signatures required on a nominating petition this year. Candidates must:
‚Ä¢ Be able to read and write.
‚Ä¢ Be a qualified voter of the District. A qualified voter of the District is a citizen of the United States, at least 18 years of age or older and not adjudged to be an incompetent.
‚Ä¢ Be and have been a resident of the District for a continuous and uninterrupted period of at least one year immediately before the election.
‚Ä¢ Have not been removed from any school district office within the preceding year.
‚Ä¢ Not reside with an other member of the same school board as a member of the same family.
‚Ä¢ Not be a current employee of the school board.
‚Ä¢ Not simultaneously hold another incompatible public office.
text:
NOTICE ON SCHOOL DISTRICT WEBSITE:
DEADLINE FOR FILING NOMINATING PETITIONS

PLEASE TAKE NOTICE that petitions for nominating candidates for office must be filed in the District Clerk‚Äôs office by 5:00 p.m. on May 11, 2020. Under NYS Governor Executive Order No. 202.26, there is no minimum threshold of signatures required on a nominating petition this year. Candidates must:
‚Ä¢ Be able to read and write.
‚Ä¢ Be a qualified voter of the District. A qualified voter of the District is a citizen of the United States, at least 18 years of age or older and not adjudged to be an incompetent.
‚Ä¢ Be and have been a resident of the District for a continuous and uninterrupted period of at least one year immediately before the election.
‚Ä¢ Have not been removed from any school district office within the preceding year.
‚Ä¢ Not reside with an other member of the same school board as a member of the same family.
‚Ä¢ Not be a current employee of the school board.
‚Ä¢ Not simultaneously hold another incompatible public office.

Don't forget! We have both pick up and home delivery of Free Breakfast and Lunch for children 18 years and younger. Meals are available on Monday and Thursday.

If you would like meals delivered to your home, please call 315-429-3155‚Äîuse extension #1803

Leave the following information:
Each child‚Äôs first and last name that needs a meal
The street address for the delivery along with the town of that address
And a return phone number
Current pick up locations will remain open if you would rather pick up the meals

We miss our students! Stay well and stay safe!

The governor announced today that New York State‚Äôs ‚Äúpause‚Äù will continue until May 15th.

We will keep you posted as we get more information. As of now -- we will return to school on May 18th.

Please be on the lookout for mailings from Mrs. Chrisman and Mrs. Leavitt about new instruction for your students beginning on April 20th.

If you have any questions or need help in any way - please feel free to contact the school.

Stay healthy and safe Dolgeville

post_text:
Hello Dolgeville Community

As we go through these uncertain times -- it's important to take the best care possible of ourselves and our family members.

Not an easy task considering all of the stress and anxiety we are all facing for so many reasons.

If you need help, in any way -- please do not hesitate to contact the school. We are open from 9:00 am - 2:00 pm on Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday. We will do our best to help in any way we can.

Also -- The link below will take you to the Catholic Charities of Herkimer County Website which lists and describes all the services available through CCHC.

https://ccherkimercounty.org/services-and-programs-2/

Please stay well and reach out to us if you need to.

CCHERKIMERCOUNTY.ORG
Services and Programs - Catholic Charities

Hello Dolgeville Community

In an effort to discourage groups of people from gathering we have made the decision to close all district outside equipment areas.

The playground, basketball caged area, pavilion and track are now closed.

We are sorry for this inconvenience -- but want to do our part to keep our community members safe.

We miss you and want you to see how much we care about you!

On Wednesday, April 1st‚Äîwe will have a parade of teachers and staff members in their cars traveling through the roads in our school district.

We are trying to get down every road in
Dolgeville, Salisbury and Stratford.

The parade will begin at 10:00 AM.

Please stay at your homes and
DO NOT gather with friends and neighbors

post_text: Attention students in grades 4-6. Mr. Gardner has created a Google Classroom for all of you to join. He will be using this classroom for the duration of the shut down. Students will have access to fun STEM challenges, keep up with computer skills and he will offer tech support for Google Classroom questions. Please use the code rpd2jpr to join his class. Make sure you are signing into Google with your @dolgeville.org username or you will not be able to join the class. No personal gmail accounts can be authorized. Contact jgardner@dolgeville.org for any questions. Thank you!
text: Attention students in grades 4-6. Mr. Gardner has created a Google Classroom for all of you to join. He will be using this classroom for the duration of the shut down. Students will have access to fun STEM challenges, keep up with computer skills and he will offer tech support for Google Classroom questions. Please use the code rpd2jpr to join his class. Make sure you are signing into Google with your @dolgeville.org username or you will not be able to join the class. No personal gmail accounts can be authorized. Contact jgardner@dolgeville.org for any questions. Thank you!

post_text: We are looking for photos of what the kids are doing while school is closed! Photos of kids taking selfies, playing outside, doing homework, painting their nails, playing games with their families, etc. These photos will potentially be included in the yearbook. Please email photo submissions to bcolenzo@dolgeville.org ASAP. Be sure to include the name of the student featured in the photo.

post_text:
Change in Meal Distribution -

Beginning Thursday, March 26th Meal distribution will be as follows:

When: Mondays and Thursdays 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM

Why: To limit the contact our Food Service workers have among themselves, as well as with parents and students.

Details: You will continue to get 5 breakfasts and 5 lunches throughout the week.‚Äîjust on a different schedule. On Mondays you will be given 3 days worth of food and on Thursdays ‚Äì 2 days worth of food.

Please Note: The times for distribution will be 11:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM Allowing our staff a little more time to assemble meals on Monday and Thursday.

We will still begin delivering meals this Wednesday ‚Äì Delivery will also be on Thursday this week and then will follow the new schedule beginning next week.

This information will also be posted on our Website and sent home via School Messenger.

Thank you for your patience as we change procedures in an effort to follow NYS and Federal guidelines.

post_text:
Given that we have new information coming very frequently from State Ed and the Governor -- we've had some questions about meals next week. Here is our answer:

WE ABSOLUTELY WILL BE SERVING CHILDREN MEALS AS THE SCHOOL SHUT DOWN CONTINUES.

Here is what Dolgeville CSD considers ESSENTIAL:

Ensuring that our children have an opportunity to eat breakfast and lunch;

Ensuring that our students have supplemental school work as we remain closed and have the opportunity to communicate with their teachers.

Stay well everyone -- if you have trouble reaching someone from the school, please give me a call at 315-429-3155 x3500. If I can't answer -- I will check my messages frequently and get back to you.

-- Lynn Rhone, Superintendent

post_text: What is Social Distancing?
text: What is Social Distancing?

post_text:
Hello Dolgeville Parents

Currently, the school buildings will remain open from 8AM - 4PM on weekdays. You and/or your students may come in during those hours to gather possessions. We are attempting to practice Social Distancing -- so we ask that you arrive, gather possessions and then leave the building.

We are working on supplying student breakfast and lunch during the time the school is shut down. We are hoping to begin meals later this week at locations in Dolgeville, Stratford and Salisbury.

Due to equity issues, we are unable to offer students any new instruction by paper or online.

We are working together to make plans for student review work if possible -- please do not expect to pick up any student work this week. As we plan -- we will keep you informed.

We will be able to offer more specific information in a few days.

-- Lynn Rhone, Superintendent

post_text: The Johnstown transportation office selected Dolgeville Central School to receive a $1584.30 donation as part of Walmart's support of local communities. Private Fleet truck drivers for Walmart-already among the safest drivers in the country- drove extra carefully during the week from July 20 through July 26, 2019. For every accident-free mile they drove during that week, Walmart made a financial contribution."This is just one of the many ways Walmart supports education across the country...It's also a great way to engage all of our drivers in raising money for our local schools."-Danielle Sexton, general transportation manager at Johnstown Walmart distribution

post_text:
Thank you for your feedback regarding the timing of communication for important events.
We are working hard to establish processes to ensure we do our best to keep you informed.

Please note...if you missed the meeting last evening, please feel free to join us at the next two meetings or the Public Hearing which will discuss the same project:

Town Hall Meeting - tomorrow evening at 6:00 at the Stratford Community Center

Town Hall Meeting - Thursday, January 23rd at 6:00pm at the Salisbury Fire Department

Public Hearing - Tuesday, February 11th at 6:00 pm at DCS Elementary Library
